intro: Littorella lacustris var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is typically found in wetland environments such as marshes and pond edges. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often used in ecological restoration projects. Its presence indicates a healthy aquatic ecosystem.
